suggestionHistory.suggestion: Read docs/codebase-index.md and summarize: 1) The main architectural patterns used, 2) Key dependencies between modules, 3) The top 3 implementation gaps that need addressing. Then update the index with any missing critical files or patterns you discover.

Create a codebase index showing: 1) Key directories and their purposes, 2) Core user flows (analyze repo → view results → upgrade → export PDF), 3) API route organization pattern, 4) Component hierarchy, 5) Database schema relationships. Focus on identifying gaps between current implementation and PRD requirements.

Create a comprehensive test suite starting with the core analyzer functions. Write tests for lib/inprod/analyzer.ts and lib/inprod/analyzers/security.ts using Vitest. Cover the analyzeRepository function, altitude calculations, and security gap detection. Include test cases for different tech stacks and missing implementations.

Create .cursorrules for this Next.js/TypeScript project. Include: file naming conventions (kebab-case for files, PascalCase for components), import order (react → next → external → @/ aliases → relative), error handling patterns (try-catch with sanitized messages for production), TypeScript strict mode requirements, Tailwind class organization, API route structure with proper validation using Zod, and testing requirements with Vitest.

Create a .cursorrules file for this Next.js/TypeScript project. Include: TypeScript strict mode conventions, React component patterns (prefer function components with TypeScript), API route error handling patterns, Prisma best practices, consistent naming (camelCase for functions/variables, PascalCase for components/types), import order conventions, and testing requirements with Vitest.
